qas.question: What was the name of the book that Darwin wrote on emotions?

answers.text: The Expression of the Emotions in Man and Animals

qas.question: Along with survival, what did Darwin see as the role of emotions in humans?
Through what process did Darwin believe emotions developed?
In what century did Darwin write?

plausible_answers.text: The Expression of the Emotions in Man and Animals

qas.question: What was the name of the book that Darwin drew on emotions?
Along with survival, what did Darwin not see as the role of emotions in humans?
Through what process did Darwin not believe emotions developed?
In what century did Darwin read?

context: Perspectives on emotions from evolutionary theory were initiated in the late <a3_0><b7_0>19th<a3_0/> century<b7_0/> with Charles Darwin's book <a0_0><b4_0>The Expression of the Emotions in Man and Animals<b4_0/><a0_0/>. Darwin argued that emotions actually served a purpose for humans, in <a1_0><b5_0>communication<b5_0/><a1_0/> and also in aiding their survival. Darwin, therefore, argued that emotions evolved via <a2_0><b6_0>natural selection<b6_0/><a2_0/> and therefore have universal cross-cultural counterparts. Darwin also detailed the virtues of experiencing emotions and the parallel experiences that occur in animals. This led the way for animal research on emotions and the eventual determination of the neural underpinnings of emotion.
